hypothesis_content.title: BTC Volatility Compression Breakout After Low-Vol Holiday Period
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC's 10-day realized volatility falls below its 30-day rolling 20th percentile during a NEUTRAL regime, and the BTC/USD pair trades within a 3% range for 5 consecutive days, a volatility expansion of at least 15% (10-day RV) will occur within the next 5 trading days, with direction biased toward the breakout of the 5-day range.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Holiday periods and neutral regimes often see suppressed volatility as participation drops. This creates a 'coiled spring' effect where pent-up trading demand eventually expresses itself through a volatility expansion. The 5-day range constraint ensures genuine compression, not just low volatility in a trend.
entry_conditions: BTC daily high-low range < 3% for 5 consecutive days
No major macro news/events scheduled within 48 hours

exit_conditions.take_profit: 10-day realized volatility increases by 15% from entry level
exit_conditions.stop_loss: 10-day realized volatility decreases further by 5% from entry level
exit_conditions.time_exit: 5 trading days after entry if no trigger

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Volatility remains compressed (< 5% increase) for 7+ days following the setup, or breaks lower in volatility instead of expanding.
